section.title: Overview
section.para: Pardus is a Linux distribution developed as a product of the Pardus Project, by National Research Institute of Electronics and Cryptology (UEKAE), which is under the Scientific and Technological Research Council of Turkey (TÜBİTAK) and by volunteered contributors. It is named after the Latin (and scientific) name for the Anatolian leopard, Panthera pardus tulliana.

Pardus consists of a Linux based operating system, opensource applications and related data files necessary for desktop and server environments, aiming to provide users stable, reliable, easy to use and feature rich computer experience.
